Interface of an EyeX behavior adapter, capable of assigning a certain type of behavior to an interactor, and of interpreting the corresponding events.

member.name: T:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior
member.summary: Partial class with events and properties related to the Activatable behavior.
Partial class with events and properties related to the Gaze-aware behavior.
Partial class with events and properties related to the Pannable behavior.

Class that contains all the EyeX Behavior related attached properties and events.
The class implementation is split into one file per EyeX Behavior, with the Behavior.cs file containing generic implementation.
File naming convention: Behavior.Xyz.cs contains all implementation related explicitly to the EyeX Xyz behavior.
Partial class with events and properties related to occluders (interactors without behavior).

member.name: F:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.ActivatableProperty
member.summary:
When set to a value other than None, the associated element becomes an EyeX interactor with the Activatable behavior.
-The routed event Activate will be fired when the user interacts with the element by looking at it and pressing the EyeX Direct Click key or EyeX Button (typically the Right Ctrl key, but this can be changed in the EyeX Interaction settings).
-The property ActivationFocus will be set to a value corresponding to the current activation focus state of the element, and the routed event ActivationFocusChanged will be fired whenever this value is changed.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.SetActivatable(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,EyeXFramework.Wpf.ActivatableType)
member.summary:
Sets the value of the Activatable property on a given FrameworkElement.
When set to a value other than ActivatableType.None, the associated element becomes an EyeX interactor with the Activatable behavior.
-The routed event Activate will be fired when the user interacts with the element by looking at it and pressing the EyeX Direct Click key (typically the Right Ctrl key, but this can be changed in the EyeX Interaction settings).
-The property ActivationFocus will be set to a value corresponding to the current activation focus state of the element, and the routed event ActivationFocusChanged will be fired whenever this value is changed.
member.param: The to set the property for.
The value of the property.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.GetActivatable(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Gets the value of the Activatable property on a given FrameworkElement.
member.param: The to get the property value from.
member.returns: The value of the Activatable property.

member.name: F:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.ActivationFocusProperty
member.summary:
The element can be in one of three activation focus states:
-ActivationFocus.None - the element does not have any kind of activation focus.
-ActivationFocus.HasActivationFocus - the user is pressing down the activation key, and this element would be activated if the user were to release the activation key at this instant.
-ActivationFocus.HasTentativeActivationFocus - the user is just looking around, but this element would be activated if the user were to press and release the activation key at this instant.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.SetActivationFocus(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,EyeXFramework.ActivationFocus)
member.summary:
Sets the ActivationFocus property.
Should only be set as part of the event handling of activation focus changed events from the EyeX Engine.
member.param: The to set the property value for.
The value of the property.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.GetActivationFocus(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary:
Gets the value of the ActivationFocus property on a FrameworkElement.
The element can be in one of three activation focus states:
-ActivationFocus.None - the element does not have any kind of activation focus.
-ActivationFocus.HasActivationFocus - the user is pressing down the activation key, and this element would be activated if the user were to release the activation key at this instant.
-ActivationFocus.HasTentativeActivationFocus - the user is just looking around, but this element would be activated if the user were to press and release the activation key at this instant.
member.param: The
member.returns: The the value of the ActivationFocus property.

member.name: F:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.GazeAwareProperty
member.summary:
When set to true, the associated element becomes an EyeX interactor with the Gaze-aware behavior:
Its HasGaze property will be set to true or false depending on whether the user's eye-gaze is within or outside the element's bounds, and the routed event HasGazeChanged will be fired whenever the HasGaze value is changed.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.SetGazeAware(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets the GazeAware behavior on a FrameworkElement. When set to true, the associated element becomes an EyeX interactor with the Gaze-aware behavior:
Its HasGaze property will be set to true or false depending on whether the user's eye-gaze is within or outside the element's bounds, and the routed event HasGazeChanged will be fired whenever the HasGaze value is changed.
member.param: The to set the behavior for.
The value of the HasGaze property.

member.summary:
When set to a value other than None, the associated framework element becomes an EyeX interactor with the Pannable behavior.
-The routed event Pannable will be fired when the user interacts with the scrollViewer by looking at it and pressing the EyeX button (typically the Right Control key, but this can be changed in the EyeX settings panel). The event will contain information about the horizontal and vertical panning velocity (in pixels/second).

Sets the currently available directions.
- Should be used to dynamically update the available pan directions when panning is ongoing.
- For example: if the contents of a vertically scrollable area has been scrolled to the bottom, the down direction should temporarily be removed from the available directions until the contents has been scrolled up again.

member.name: F:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.WpfInteractorProperty
member.summary:
Holds the WpfInteractor object associated with a FrameworkElement.
The WpfInteractor class stores information about EyeX behaviors set on the element, and other information needed to create an EyeX interactor based on the element, and also delegates handling of events from the EyeX Engine to the attached EyeX behaviors.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.SetWpfInteractor(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor)
member.summary: Sets the WpfInteractor property for a given FrameworkElement.
member.param: The to set the property for.
The value of the property.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.GetWpfInteractor(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary:
Gets the WpfInteractor of the FrameworkElement.
This method returns null for a FrameworkElement with no set EyeX Behaviors. Code that need a reference to the WpfInteractor, to be able to add an EyeX Behavior to it, should use the GetWpfInteractorOrDefault method instead.
member.param: The to get the interactor from.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.GetWpfInteractorOrDefault(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary:
Gets the WpfInteractor for the FrameworkElement, or if the WpfInteractor is null, creates, sets and returns an empty WpfInteractor.
This method should be used for code that need a reference to the WpfInteractor to add an EyeX Behavior to it.
member.param: The to get the object from.
member.returns: The WpfInteractor for the FrameworkElement, or a default instance.

member.name: F:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.IsOccluderProperty
member.summary:
When set to true, the associated element becomes an EyeX interactor with no behavior.
An EyeX interactor with no behavior is the definition of an occluder in the eyes of the EyeX Engine. An occluder will block eye-gaze interaction from reaching parts of the screen that are behind it.
For the occluder to work correctly, its branch in the interactor tree has to have a higher Z value than the branch of interactors it is suppose to occlude.
If a visual element is drawn on top of another visual element, but is not explicitly declared to be an occluder, it will be treated as if it were transparent by the EyeX Engine.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.SetIsOccluder(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets the IsOccluder property on a FrameworkElement.
When set to true, the associated element becomes an EyeX interactor with no behavior.
An EyeX interactor with no behavior is the definition of an occluder in the eyes of the EyeX Engine. An occluder will block eye-gaze interaction from reaching parts of the screen that are behind it.
For the occluder to work correctly, its branch in the interactor tree has to have a higher Z value than the branch of interactors it is suppose to occlude.
If a visual element is drawn on top of another visual element, but is not explicitly declared to be an occluder, it will be treated as if it were transparent by the EyeX Engine.
member.param: The to set the IsOccluder property for.
The value of the IsOccluder property.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior.GetIsOccluder(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Gets the IsOccluder property of a FrameworkElement.
member.param: The to get the property from.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the FrameworkElement is an occluder or not.

member.name: T:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor
member.summary:
A WpfInteractor is the WPF representation of an EyeX interactor, based on a FrameworkElement.
An EyeX interactor covers a certain region of the screen, and is part of a logical tree of interactors, with z ordering between siblings, and a parent being either the window it belongs to (defined as the root) or another interactor.
In this sense, EyeX interactors corresponds very well to FrameworkElements in the WPF framework. FrameworkElements have an actual width and actual height and is related to other FrameworkElements by their placement in the visual tree. The WpfInteractor tree is made up of the subset of elements in the visual tree that have an WpfInteractor object with at least one added EyeX Behavior.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An application-wide unique identifier for this WpfInteractor.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor.CreateEmpty
member.summary: Creates an empty WpfInteractor with no attached EyeX Behavior.

member.summary: Adds the supplied IEyeXBehavior to this WpfInteractor and saves a references to the associated FrameworkElement if this is the first added behavior. Will replace any already added behavior with the same BehaviorType.
member.param: The where to add the behavior.
The to add.

member.summary: Gets the behavior matching the specified .

member.param: The to add the interactor to.

member.summary: Occurs when the last EyeX Behavior is removed from this WpfInteractor, so it should no longer be treated as an interactor in the eyes of the EyeX Engine.

member.name: P:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor.Id
member.summary: Gets an application-wide unique identifier for this WpfInteractor. This id is used by the EyeX Engine to identify interactors, and is the id set on EyeX events to specify which interactor the event is raised for.

member.name: P:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor.ParentId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique id of the parent WpfInteractor or the root id (if the WpfInteractor node is logically attached directly to the window root node).

member.name: P:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor.Z
member.summary: Gets or sets the Z ordering of this WpfInteractor compared to its sibling interactors (sharing the same parent id). A WpfInteractor with a higher Z value is considered to be on top of and to cover a WpfInteractor with a lower Z value.

member.name: P:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor.WindowId
member.summary: Gets the window handle of the top level window the associated FrameworkElement belongs to.

member.name: P:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfInteractor.Element
member.summary: Gets the FrameworkElement associated with this WpfInteractor. It is on this element the attached properties from the EyeXFramework.Wpf.Behavior class have been set, and it is on this element routed EyeX Behavior events will be raised.

member.name: T:EyeXFramework.Wpf.ElementEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments associated with the and events.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.ElementEventArgs.#ctor(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The related to the event.

member.name: P:EyeXFramework.Wpf.ElementEventArgs.Element
member.summary: Gets the related to the event.

member.name: T:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost
member.summary: Provides the main point of contact with the EyeX Engine. Hosts an EyeX context and responds to engine queries using a repository of WpfInteractors.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cleans up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost.HandleQuery(Tobii.EyeX.Client.Query)
member.summary: Handles a query from the EyeX Engine.
member.remarks: Called from a worker thread. GUI object access has to be dispatched to UI thread.
member.param: Query to be handled.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost.HandleEvent(Tobii.EyeX.Client.InteractionEvent)
member.summary: Handles an event from the EyeX Engine.
member.remarks: Called from a worker thread. GUI object access has to be dispatched to UI thread.
member.param: Event to be handled.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost.RunOnMainThread(System.Action)
member.summary: Marshals the given operation to the UI thread.
member.param: The operation to be performed.
member.returns: True if the marshaling operation was successful.

The .

The .

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost.GetWindowsWithInteractors
member.summary: Returns all windows for which there are child elements that are interactors.
member.returns: All windows with interactors, or an empty list if there are no interactors.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost.GetInteractors
member.summary: Gets all interactors.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfEyeXHost.GetInteractor(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the interactor with the specified interactor id.
member.param: The id of the interactor to be returned.
member.returns: The interactor with Id interactorId, or null if not found.

member.summary: Creates a commits a snapshot with the given interactors.

A list of interactors intersecting the given query's bounds.

member.name: T:EyeXFramework.Wpf.OccluderBehavior
member.summary: Maps a dummy behavior to an interactor.
member.remarks: The OccluderBehavior class is only needed for the WPF framework and is therefore implemented here.

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.OccluderBehavior.AssignBehavior(Tobii.EyeX.Client.Interactor)
member.summary: Does nothing.
member.param: The interactor to do nothing with.

member.summary: Does nothing.
member.param: The sender to do nothing with.
The instances containing the event data.

member.name: P:EyeXFramework.Wpf.OccluderBehavior.BehaviorType
member.summary: Gets the behavior type, which in this case is "no behavior".

member.name: T:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfCrawler
member.summary: Helper class for traversing and hit testing visual trees in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

member.name: M:EyeXFramework.Wpf.WpfCrawler.GetInteractors(System.Windows.Media.Visual,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary:
Gets the set of interactors within a given query rectangle.
In interactor is defined as a FrameworkElement with an Behavior attached property set on it.
member.param: A top level window
Query rectangle in screen coordinates

member.summary: Updates the ParentId and Z properties of all interactors in the visual tree rooted at the given topElement.

Id of the interactor parent.
